identificationModule.briefTitle: A Comparative Study Between Amlodipine 10mg And 5mg With Hypertension For Whom 5mg Is Insufficient
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Double-Blind, Comparative Study Between Amlodipine 5mg And 10mg In Patients With Essential Hypertension For Whom Amlodipine 5mg Is Insufficiently Effective

leadSponsor.name: Pfizer's Upjohn has merged with Mylan to form Viatris Inc.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The changes in the trough systolic blood pressure from the baseline were assessed after 8 weeks of double-blind treatment with amlodipine 10 mg or amlodipine 5 mg

primaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) From Baseline to Week 8
primaryOutcomes.description: Mean change in the trough SBP

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Change in Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) From Baseline to Week 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: Mean change in the trough DBP

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Combined Mean Change in SBP From Baseline to Week 6 and Week 8 (Mean by Patient)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Arithmetic mean of Week 6 \& Week 8 by patient for "Change from baseline in SBP at Week 6" and "Change from baseline in SBP at Week 8"

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Combined Mean Change in DBP From Baseline to Week 6 and Week 8 (Mean by Patient)
secondaryOutcomes.description: Arithmetic mean of Week 6 \& Week 8 by patient for "Change from baseline in DBP at Week 6" and "Change from baseline in DBP at Week 8"

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects Achieving the Target Blood Pressure Reduction Value at Week 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: Target blood pressure reduction value based on Japan Society of Hypertension Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension 2004: SBP below 130 mmHg and DBP below 85 mmHg for \<=64 years old; SBP below 140 mmHg and DBP below 90 mmHg for \>=65 years old

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Combined Number of Subjects Achieving the Target Blood Pressure Reduction Value at Both Weeks 6 and 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: Target blood pressure reduction value based on Japan Society of Hypertension Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension 2004: SBP below 130 mmHg and DBP below 85 mmHg for \<=64 years old; SBP below 140 mmHg and DBP below 90 mmHg for \>=65 years old

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Number of Subjects Achieving the Target Blood Pressure Reduction Value and Whose SBP Decreased From Baseline by >= 10 mmHg at Week 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: Target blood pressure reduction value based on Japan Society of Hypertension Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension 2004: SBP below 130 mmHg and DBP below 85 mmHg for \<=64 years old; SBP below 140 mmHg and DBP below 90 mmHg for \>=65 years old

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Combined Number of Subjects Achieving the Target Blood Pressure Reduction Value and Whose SBP Decreased From Baseline by >= 10 mmHg at Both Weeks 6 and 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: Target blood pressure reduction value based on Japan Society of Hypertension Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension 2004: SBP below 130 mmHg and DBP below 85 mmHg for \<=64 years old; SBP below 140 mmHg and DBP below 90 mmHg for \>=65 years old

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Trough Plasma Concentrations of Amlodipine -Amlodipine 5 mg
Trough Plasma Concentrations of Amlodipine -Amlodipine 10 mg

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Untreated Hypertensive Patients: An systolic blood pressure of \>=160 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure \>=100mmHg.
* Treated Hypertensive Patients: An systolic blood pressure of \>=140 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure of \>= 90 mmHg.
* Patients with insufficient response to 5 mg of amlodipine in the screening period:Two successive systolic blood pressure measurements at Visit 4 (Week -2) and Visit 5 (Week 0 = baseline) \>=140 mmHg
* Patients with a screening treatment compliance rate \>= 80%

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subjects with secondary hypertension (renal disease, pheochromocytoma, and Cushing's syndrome, etc.), severe hypertension (systolic blood pressure of 180 mmHg or higher, or diastolic blood pressure of 110 mmHg or higher), and malignant hypertension

seeAlsoLinks.label: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participantFlowModule.preAssignmentDetails: Consent was taken from 414 patients, 356 patients who met the screening criteria received amlodipine 5 mg. After the 8 weeks of screening treatment, patients who met the entry criteria for double-blind period were randomized to either the amlodipine 10 mg group or the amlodipine 5 mg group at a ratio of 1:1.

groups.title: Amlodipine 5 mg
groups.description: One amlodipine besilate 5 mg tablet and 1 amlodipine besilate 5 mg placebo tablet were administered once daily after breakfast for 8 weeks.

groups.title: Amlodipine 10 mg
groups.description: Two amlodipine besilate 5 mg tablets were administered once daily after breakfast for 8 weeks.

groups.title: Amlodipine 5 mg
groups.description: One amlodipine besilate 5 mg tablet and 1 amlodipine besilate 5 mg placebo tablet were administered once daily after breakfast for 8 weeks.

groups.title: Amlodipine 10 mg
groups.description: Two amlodipine besilate 5 mg tablets were administered once daily after breakfast for 8 weeks.

groups.title: Total
groups.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) From Baseline to Week 8
outcomeMeasures.description: Mean change in the trough SBP
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Full Analysis Set, Last Observation Carried Forward

groups.title: Amlodipine 5 mg
groups.description: One amlodipine besilate 5 mg tablet and 1 amlodipine besilate 5 mg placebo tablet were administered once daily after breakfast for 8 weeks.

groups.title: Amlodipine 10 mg
groups.description: Two amlodipine besilate 5 mg tablets were administered once daily after breakfast for 8 weeks.

analyses.groupDescription: The hypothesis of no group differences (null hypothesis) was tested against that of the amlodipine 10 mg arm being superior to the amlodipine 5 mg arm (alternative hypothesis). ANCOVA models with the trough SBP at baseline, body weight, and age as covariates, and the treatment group and study site as factors was used. The test was performed with a significance level of 0.05 (two-sided).

ANCOVA models with the trough DBP at baseline, body weight, and age as covariates, and the treatment group and study site as factors was used. The test was performed with a significance level of 0.05 (two-sided).

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Subjects Achieving the Target Blood Pressure Reduction Value at Week 8
outcomeMeasures.description: Target blood pressure reduction value based on Japan Society of Hypertension Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension 2004: SBP below 130 mmHg and DBP below 85 mmHg for \<=64 years old; SBP below 140 mmHg and DBP below 90 mmHg for \>=65 years old
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Full Analysis Set, Last Observation Carried Forward

groups.title: Amlodipine 5 mg
groups.description: One amlodipine besilate 5 mg tablet and 1 amlodipine besilate 5 mg placebo tablet were administered once daily after breakfast for 8 weeks.

groups.title: Amlodipine 10 mg
groups.description: Two amlodipine besilate 5 mg tablets were administered once daily after breakfast for 8 weeks.

analyses.groupDescription: Proportions of participants (responder rates) were used for the statistical analyses. The hypothesis of no group differences (null hypothesis) was tested against that of the amlodipine 10 mg arm being superior to the amlodipine 5 mg arm (alternative hypothesis). The test was conducted based on a logistic regression model with baseline SBP value and body weight as covariates, and treatment group and age (\<=64, \>=65) as a factor. The significance level was 0.05 (two-sided).

outcomeMeasures.title: Combined Number of Subjects Achieving the Target Blood Pressure Reduction Value at Both Weeks 6 and 8
outcomeMeasures.description: Target blood pressure reduction value based on Japan Society of Hypertension Guidelines for the Management of Hypertension 2004: SBP below 130 mmHg and DBP below 85 mmHg for \<=64 years old; SBP below 140 mmHg and DBP below 90 mmHg for \>=65 years old
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Full Analysis Set, Last Observation Carried Forward

outcomeMeasures.title: Trough Plasma Concentrations of Amlodipine -Amlodipine 5 mg
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Plasma concentration obtained after temporarily dosing discontinuation or not matched with the following conditions were excluded from the analysis; Steady-state condition: at least 80% drug compliance from the previous visit to the day of sampling; Trough condition: samples taken within ±10% of 24 hours from last dosing.

groups.title: Baseline
groups.description: After once daily administration of amlodipine 5 mg for 8 weeks in the screening period

outcomeMeasures.title: Trough Plasma Concentrations of Amlodipine -Amlodipine 10 mg
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: Plasma concentration obtained after temporarily dosing discontinuation or not matched with the following conditions were excluded from the analysis; Steady-state condition: at least 80% drug compliance from the previous visit to the day of sampling; Trough condition: samples taken within ±10% of 24 hours from last dosing.

certainAgreement.otherDetails: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of \<60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), \<12 mo from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential info other than study results.
